Displaying data for configured deadlines
The information about configured deadlines
(
Deadlines directory
)
is displayed in the table of the corresponding registry and is generated automatically
when the route object passes through the business process (BP;
General info about business processes
).
These settings are represented in the System by the object type
"WF. Regulatory term example"
.
The "Overdue" column displays a timer that counts the time of delay by the deadline. If the deadline is not expired, the timer registers zero.
To open the instance profile of the type
"WorkFlow. Deadline instance"
double-click on an entry in the table.
The profile contains the following attribute structure, where many fields are filled in automatically:
Setting
Purpose
Deadline
The main name of the deadline setting.
Deadline - Technical deadline
The main name of the technical deadline setting (for more information, refer to
Deadlines directory
, the "Schedule date" block of fields).
Date and time of creation
Date and exact time of creating a deadline instance.
Object
The name of the route object instance.
Process instance
Name of the business process instance the deadline is specified for.
Responsible department
User/ group of users of the business process that takes into account the current deadline.
Activity marker
A boolean attribute, possible values:
Yes – there are active tasks with the deadline considered
No – all tasks included in the calculation of the deadline under consideration have been completed
Status
The status of the deadline calculation. Possible values:
In progress
Completed
Suspended
The "Deadline" block of fields
Deadline in business days
Enter
the number of business days to specify the deadline.
Actual term in business days
The actual deadline in business days.
Total suspension period
General term of deadlines suspended.
Date and time of deadline start
Date and time of the start of the deadline countdown in accordance with the deadline setting (for more information, refer to "Deadlines directory"). For example, if the deadline is calculated based on the calendar and working hours, and the deadline instance is created outside the working hours of a potential task assignee, the date of creation and the start date of the deadline may be different.
Schedule date
Duration of the deadline. Suspensions do not affect the schedule date (for more information, refer to
Suspension of deadlines
).
Suspension of deadline
Suspending the deadline countdown.
Date and time of the actual deadline end
The completion date for all tasks that take into account the configurable deadline.
Schedule date (months)
The duration of the deadline calculated in months.
Date and time of the schedule deadline end
The date of the schedule deadline end, after which it will be considered that the deadline is overdue.
Actual term (months)
Total time spent for the current deadline.
The "Task breakdown" and "Excluded tasks on the business process" groups of fields
Task on the business process
The name of the BP task the deadline of which is calculated.
Excluded tasks on the business process
The name of the BP task that does not take into account the deadline.
Example of
configuring the deadline with recalculation on demand
.
If you need to change the length of the deadline, make changes to the
"Deadline in business days"
attribute. When changes are saved, the associated attributes are recalculated automatically. Users who have a special permission can change the deadline (for more information, refer to
Working with permissions
).
It is possible to configure the work of users (groups of users) in the System with the following permissions (for more information, refer to
Working with permissions
):
Change incomplete deadlines
Change any deadlines
To work with deadlines, actions are used (
both schedule and actual time is taken into account
):
– recalculation of information about the deadline in the data warehouse. The action recalculates information in the instance of
"WorkFlow. Deadline instance"
– recalculation of deadline for the route object Recalculation of deadline is performed for a specific route object specified in the settings. Recalculation of deadlines is performed for the object types (associated with the route object specified):
"
WorkFlow. Deadline instance
"
"
WorkFlow. Deadline
"
